intro: Cryptostephane, commonly known as the "false holly," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Euphorbiaceae. It consists of a single species, Cryptostephane tetrandra, which is native to the Andes mountains in South America. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and smooth, dark green leaves. It produces bright red berries that are toxic to humans and animals. Cryptostephane is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique appearance.
